reviews.text:
the tour was alright. there were two guides, we got the older lady who mumbled/spoke rather fast. we preferred the younger lady who had clear, strong voice, and spoke at a slower speed (perfect for non-native english speakers).

the tour took about 45 minutes, and was very informative. highly recommended, as the tour price is great bang for buck.

Beautiful and well preserved/maintained Baba Nyonya House with rich history/heritage, part of which is inhabited by the family still. Had a tour guide to myself, it was brilliantly informative. Highly recommend.

No photography inside, except on the main entrance. Tried the self guided tour, information provided on the book is quite detailed, however there are many photographs on the wall which we have no idea who were inside and what’s the event of the photograph beside main photographs of house owners. There are some collections that we can admire from the artistic design and complex peranakan pattern but we can’t understand the historical story behind as there’s no information provided about them.

The museum has a lot of artifacts. Didn't manage to get a guided tour because I brought 2 children below 7 years old. We were given 2 guide books to read about the place as we tour the place. Booklet is informative though.

Authentic and well preserved.  Intricately carved furniture, cupboards, doors and staircase. Even saw an old style ice cream maker and ice box! An old iron, using burning coal to give heat.  Bamboo Mahjong Set, and beautiful tea and dinner service.  Own well in a courtyard within the house as a source of water. Gives a rare insight into a bygone lifestyle that was full of tradition. Lovely!

If you're in Thailand and looking for Sunday worship. This is a great English speaking Anglican Church. Services are Sunday morning 7am and 10:00 am English worship. 1:00 pm. Thai whorship service. They have Sunday school for the kids. Potluck lunches after the service to meet and greet.
Nice playgroup on Wednesdays and Fridays. The pastor is very kind and we enjoyed the Sunday service on Easter.
Really moving experience-great interaction with sooo many cultures.
The Christmas morning service was lively and awesome.  There are washrooms (even for the disabled).
A true reflection of God's people a place of worship with dignity I love this church for all people come and be blessed

Group of 9 of us stayed one night at this pleasant little hotel by the Melaka river. We had the entire upstairs rooms by ourselves. Ideal location just next to food haven Jonker Street and Historical Melaka sites. Superb hospitality by the owner Selen and his staff. Rooms are fairly big with comfortable beds and basic amenities. Overall awesome place and definitely value for money.

Truly exceptional Malay food, with the nicest set of owners you ever met. We got personalized service, suggestions and the best meal we had in Malacca. After our meal the owner shared a glass of $300/bottle single malt with us freely. Cool old pictures on the wall in a semi-historical colonial building. Something for everyone here!
Very tasty and malay sangaaaat!! Chapest one!
Nice Guesthouse, all river view rooms & location near to Jonker Walk, river walk & Dutch Square.

I came in to exchange currency, they quoted me a rate, then spent 5 minutes looking at the money I gave them, taking pictures and calling their boss, and then lowered the rate. I don't know about the coffe, but the business practices are shady, so I wouldn't recommend it.
This museum gave a very brief overview of the maritime industry in Croatia. If visiting, I suggest purchasing the Dubrovnik card which will allow entry to this and other museums.
An interesting range of exhibits and the museum is worth a visit if you have a few days in Dubrovnik.

This is a nice place to visit if you're on the Dubrovnik Card.
Lots of nice exhibits, takes you back in time though the perspective of the most important trade in Dubrovnik's history.

Worth checking out if you've purchased the Dubrovnik pass, otherwise quite expensive. Lots of interesting maritime history directly related to the area. You're not permitted to take pictures (why?) I still took a couple.. Ssshhhhh ;)
Great presentation in very fitting environment
Very valuable exhibits and information. The aircon is insufficient though. Quite stuffy inside.
The Core by Fai Zakaria art exhibition was awesome.
Great exhibition on the history and culture of the Malay people, in Malaysia as well as Indonesia
The Malay And Islamic world Museum. Travel Destination.

I learnt infos from the Discovery of Human body program though I did find the program boring. I could go home and read about anatomy. 

However, I am impressed by such beautiful plastination. It has taught me to become more aware of myself.

My main review is for the museum upstairs.
Well, it's quiet - not maintained. All the materials don't or won't intrigue locals or foreigners. 

I recalled my Form 1 History class from all the materials shown.

Regardless of my time spent, it is not worth it. 

I'd rather walk outside and look for foods.
It's about 100y/o mosque! I just can't believe it! It is beautiful! 😍❤❤ till we meet again!
A sense of calmness within this simple and nostalgic design. Love the type of pool to do your wudhu.
Awesome mosque. The oldest mosque in Malaysia. Nice architecture and unique shape. Still functioning as an mosque.
Peaceful place over 100 years
Legendary mosque...over 100 years establisment...

Good to see effort are exercised to preserve the historical building. Same supportive structure was also seen in the church.

Suggest to go see it while it still stand. A photo from the back is better as there's less people walking around.

Very old fort with cannons. But also very small due to the age and not much left standing. It's worth a look if you're passing by. And it's close to a big mall so visit both if you to there. Especially if it's really hot like when we were there. The malls air con was a great relief.

One of the historical remains of the Portuguese when they ruled Malacca. Touring into the fort I came to St Francis Xavier statue located infront of St Paul's Church. His statue was without the right hand. The church is located on top of a hill and the view from the hill is nice. Many tourist walks up to see the church and many stalls selling local souvenirs to take home.pp"
Just awesome. Apart from the scorching Sun's heat. My kids loved it. It just doesn't bores me as many times as I visit it.
Interesting walk around the site.  Full of history and i enjoyed my time there.  The church had quite a take to tell.

Amazing place

Do u know?

The Malaysia Youth Museum (Malay: Muzium Belia Malaysia) is a museum in Melaka City, Melaka, Malaysia.[1][2][3] The museum is dedicated to the youth of Malaysia,[4] and their contribution to the economic and social well-being at regional, national, and international levels.[5]

	History	Edit
The museum building was formerly used as part of the Dutch Administrative Complex during the Dutch Malacca. It was later converted into a post office and subsequently an Anglo-Chinese School in 1931. It was finally turned into a museum and was officially opened by then Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad on 15 April 1992.[6]

Architecture	Edit
The museum is located on the ground floor of the building, while the upper floor houses the Melaka Art Gallery.

It is located in a cluster at Bandar Kilir along with core Melaka historic sites: A Famosa, St Paul's Church, the Stadthuys, Christ Church, the Proclamation of Independence Memorial and the Malacca Sultanate Palace Museum.[7]

Exhibitions	Edit
The museum houses documents and information related to various Malaysian youth organisations locally and internationally

- Good: Very cheap entrance ticket (RM3 for adult); kind and friendly staff; super big museum; have the bend to sit and watch the  TV; not crowded anymore and near the Christ Church Melaka.
- Bad: Nothing.

The Malaysian Youth Museum is a museum located at No. 430, Jalan Laksamana, Melaka, Malaysia. The previous building houses the Post Office, Malacca. The museum serves as a center for youth activity documentation that showcases materials and information related to the activities of the Youth Association in Malaysia and internationally. The main ingredient of the exhibition is the picture of the leaders of youth leaders, trophies, uniforms and so on. The Malaysian Youth Museum was inaugurated by Tun Dr. Mahathir bin Mohammad, Prime Minister of Malaysia on April 15, 1992. This building was originally part of the Dutch Administration Office complex. It was made as Anglo-Chinese School (now known as Melaka High School). The objective of the museum is including to realize a single center for documentation of young activities for the purpose of study and information. To keep all records and items of the day's activities in a systematic and orderly manner that contains the history of clubs and young people from all countries. To generate public awareness, especially young people about the contribution of young activities to the community, nation and state. The entrance Pay for adults I s only RM1 and Children or Students only for 50 cents. Operation Time is from 9.30 am - 5.30 pm (Closed on the day of Isnin)
Must visit museum
Nothing much to see. More to local youth politics
Malacca River is an iconic place to be visited in Malacca. There are a lot of traditional building among the river. You can enjoy the beautiful view, especially at the night.

Peaceful ancient town with beautiful & massive & seamless graffiti along the river. Try chicken rice ball, one of signature dish there. There are different museum i.e People Museum, Stamp museum, Maritime museum, or Museum of Royal Malaysian Customs, so on.
River cruise is wonderful and colorful. If you visit there, must go for it.
Enjoying Malacca Riverside at night with tons of lighting reflection on the water was memorable whilst sitting and hearing birds chirping. Malacca River Cruise is available to try tho.
Nice for a boat ride , price is fairly acceptable,river is clean
Good historical place, but it might be easy to overlook this place and very hard to find a proper parking here, most of the vehicles just park at the roadside.

A well maintained and documented historical site. There is a gallery showing the visits of four leaders from PR of China, fauno and flora found on Bukit China, conservation and beautification of Bukit China.

Poh San Teng Temple, located at the foot of Bukit Cina (the biggest chinese cemetary in Malaysia) and next to HANG LI POH WELL or THE KING'S WELL.

It was founded in 1795 by Kapitan China Chua Su Cheong as a graveyard temple, to allow the descendants of those buried on Bukit China to conduct prayers to their ancestors away from heavy rain and winds.

The main deity is "Fu De Zheng Shen" or "Tua Pek Kong". It is the tradition of the Chinese in China as well as Malaysia to dedicate graveyard temples to Tua Pek Kong,  a local Chinese God in control of the land and the wealth.

The name of the temple, Poh San Teng, is inscribed on a 1795 tablet during its founding and is also above the front door of the temple. But many people prefer to call it Sam Po Keng, which is the nick name of the famous Chinese Admiral Cheng Ho (Zheng He). However, the history does not give us any clear information how this "mix up" happened. But from my experience it is easy to get confused about the names here with both Hokkien, Mandarin, Cantonese and English used by people.

The temple has been upgraded after Cheng Hoon Teng got involved in the management and now offer more information about the temple and it's history. It's well worth a visit to find out more about Melakas 3rd oldest Taoist Temple
Sam Po Keng Temple provide health and happiness for its devotees.  CEO of YBL International Sdn Bhd.
A great place with historical significance.

It wasn't open when we were told it was, but! Nevertheless we still saw a majority of the sight with the help of our local guide it was quite the experience. Beautiful sun set and a miraculous feeling of walking in places where many stood before. The open burial site was creepily amazing.

The sign for this place is quite small. Come inside and you will see the place. It locates opposite from Japanese village but there is no boat service so, you have to come on the road over the bridge to another side. It's a historical and  peaceful place but not many ppl visit this place. On the day I visited, they have the demonstration for Roti Saimai (thai roti) so, we got to experience it but I dont think it's a regular service.

Feel depressed for this historical treasure. The village was deserted, none sign, none restoration, just bit of pictures on the board and whole load of skeleton to show that you came to the right place. Wish the involved party could take a look and promote this place more as for historical value.
A very interesting historic place. They have real skeletons and boards to read

reviews.author_name: อาชวิน อินทมี
reviews.text: not many cool history facts to see. By the way, it's open for free.

This is a well-preserved historical site on top of a little hill. It was a fort during Portuguese and Dutch rule. There are information board for visitors to understand more about its history. Now this is a popular place for joggers, especially in the morning and evening. There is a road leading up to the fort, with trees along the road providing canopy. You can park your car at the foothill, and walk up about 400metres to the fort, or you can drive your car up but the road is quite narrow. There are monkeys on the trees but they are friendly.
Best place for light exercise...nice view n historical place.
The site is quite secluded but is well taken care of.

This fort was built during the Portuguese rules in Melaka. It was built to guide and protect the territory against external invasion. The Melaka was trade centre in the East Asia as it has access to the ocean, and two moonsoon. Arabia and other European pass through the then great city for trade and other commercial purposes.
So nice view....!

It's good to have a zoo in melaka. A very good place to relax your mind with plenty of animals. Good for education to educate children with flora and fauna. Easy to get access with o lot of parking lot. There are also have hotel nearby which are affordable. Have a nice ride in the zoo and can play with animals. Have the attractive animals show too. Lovely
A good experience for kids to gain some knowledge about wildlife animal... Very fair price... Keep it up...
A best  experience  to everybody especially  a kid that need a new knowledge to create more imagination in their life.. My babies enjoy it very much..

This was my first time visiting Zoo Melaka and I was excited. There were various species of animals and birds to be seen with your own eyes. I mean, for real.

There was almost afternoon, and some of the animals were sleeping and resting. Better go in the morning or late in the evening i guess. But still I enjoyed so much watching them. Really want to pet a tiger, but you know, you're food. haha

Surprisingly, the owls stayed awake. Its funny to see the tortoises hid themselves because the monkeys were playing around. To be safe, surely.

Thanks for reading, see the world maybe! In shaa Allah

Very good place to bring kids to see animals, and zoo melaka also has a feeding time where you can watch the worker feeds the animal or you can feed the yourself (animal that is not so aggressive like horse and elephant). You can also just walk though the entire zoo or purchase a ticket for a tram ( car pull carriage). The price of the ticket is affordable. Be sure to bring water also since it's hot in there.
This place have a very good view but some culture house need some renovation including old culture arcade equipment to complete as originality Malaysian history.

taman yang mencerminkan seni bina tradisional rumah-rumah setiap negeri di Malaysia.terdapat tarian kebudayaan jika anda datang sesuai pada masanya dan demo masakan di dalam beberapa buah rumah.gerai nasi ayam terbaik di sini di sebelah kanan pintu masuk taman.juga disediaksn gerai membeli cendera mata.
Memaparkan rumah2 lama mengikut negeri2 di malaysia dan negara asia
Harga tiket tinggi sangat
Best Nasi Goreng Daging Black Peper in town.

Many people confused this with the cafe. They belongs to the same owner but this is the shop where you buy and go. If you want to dine in, can always go to the cafe, it is not too far down the road but would still recommend to drive over especially under such hot sun. 

Personal favorite: onde onde! (But you gotta eat it fresh)
Nice pastries. We got quite a few for take aways. Will drop again if you go by this area.
Excellent nyonya kuih. Come early to have more choices. Accepts credit cards over 50 ringgit.
Whole family members had diarrhoea after having dinner. Food not fresh. Food might be reheat as served less than 5 mins after ordering. Not recommend place to dine.
Most authentic nyonya kueh. Hidden in an alleyway. Must visit if you are in malacca.

The atmosphere here is really relaxing as it is by the sea. The good is so so, I ordered a fried rice, butter squid n steamed ladies fingers with belacan. The rice was normal, the squid was not really good but the ladies fingers goes well with the spicy chili. Overall, a good place to have a beer n hang out, plus the owner is very friendly.

Nice place for relax while dine.
The food taste slightly different to me as 3 years ago. But still good.
Staff all efficient and good manners
Great ambience! Excellent food! Reasonable price! Would highly recommend the salted duck egg prawns and hot plate tau foo😁😁😁

Very disappointed with the food served. 
1. Yam cake too crispy and salty. 
2. Spring onion ostrich meat too tender. Requested to cook one more time. But still the same. Hard and salty. 
3 Fried chicken wing. Over fried,  so hard. 
4. Spring onion fish fillet so salty. 
Majority all the food were salty. 
I spent RM 180 but the the taste not worth for what I spent .
nice atmosphere but food is too pricey (especially fish dishes) for its average taste. way better and cheaper seafood restaurants out there in melaka.
Best hotel. Good value for money. Ample.space. good for photos. Cozy. Make sure go check out the patio and koi pond

The food were extremely appealing and good. The chef himself is very sincere and friendly, and the food he cooks is out of the world. 
I have been to several commercialized nyonya restaurants in Melaka, but this is the best i can find. Even my mum, grew up in Malaysia and has 40 years of experience in cooking also say they make extremely delicious nyonya food. The food will  not disappoint. Highly recommended.

The pillows were smelly, the bed and sheets were as bad. When i asked to change the pillows and be given fresh sheets, i had to collect it myself 3 floors down. Pillows came with no covers coz the cases were kept elsewhere. And the pillows were soiled. Yucks

Very nice looking hotel with old fashioned deco. Gives you countless insta moments. The cafe opposite the hotel sells good salted egg yolk croissant. Don't really like the toilet tho and need to climb up stairs with heavy luggage.

Hotel with great theme concept and comfortable bed, that's it. Cleanliness is not at their best, stain on the pillow cover, bathroom, carpet is not vacuum, stain on the TV and defects around the room. Not to mention there isn't any elevator in the hotel so u have to carry your luggage to your room via staircase. I would recommend this hotel to you if you are an Instagramer. It is a great Instagramable hotel.

Group of 9 of us stayed one night at this pleasant little hotel by the Melaka river. We had the entire upstairs rooms by ourselves. Ideal location just next to food haven Jonker Street and Historical Melaka sites. Superb hospitality by the owner Selen and his staff. Rooms are fairly big with comfortable beds and basic amenities. Overall awesome place and definitely value for money.

Truly exceptional Malay food, with the nicest set of owners you ever met. We got personalized service, suggestions and the best meal we had in Malacca. After our meal the owner shared a glass of $300/bottle single malt with us freely. Cool old pictures on the wall in a semi-historical colonial building. Something for everyone here!
Very tasty and malay sangaaaat!! Chapest one!
Nice Guesthouse, all river view rooms & location near to Jonker Walk, river walk & Dutch Square.

I came in to exchange currency, they quoted me a rate, then spent 5 minutes looking at the money I gave them, taking pictures and calling their boss, and then lowered the rate. I don't know about the coffe, but the business practices are shady, so I wouldn't recommend it.
